title: Top Frieze week auction lots, from a painting belonging to Jane Fonda to Banksy's House of Commons satire
text:
London’s Frieze week auctions kick off tonight when Christie’s offers the collection of the late Jeremy Lancaster, chairman of the heating and plumbing company Wolseley, who died in April.

Lancaster began collecting in 1979, when in his early forties, with the purchase of a Patrick Caulfield painting from the Waddington gallery, Mayfair. During the next 10 years, he bought steadily from 11 different London galleries (only a handful from auction), buying primarily contemporary British art – Howard Hodgkin and Bridget Riley among the most recognisable names.

Come the Nineties, though, his loyalties appeared to cement with Waddington, who took him in a more classic international direction, to works...
description: London’s Frieze week auctions kick off tonight when Christie’s offers the collection of the late Jeremy Lancaster, chairman of the heating and plumbing company Wolseley, who died in April.
